title: Update react-native to 0.60.5 and use Hermes js engine
body:
# Problem

react-native recently had a major update to 0.60. It brings a lot of improvements, including auto-linking of libraries and an improved JS engine for Android called Hermes

Hermes is the main reason we want to do this upgrade now, because the Play Store now requires to publish 64bits apks starting 1st of August. As of today are experiencing random freezes on 64bits architectures with these apks and we have tried many options already https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/8665

This effort will take some time because nix makes the update process less trivial than it uses to be, and we also have a few libraries that are deprecated in favor of community maintain libraries that we need to switch.

## Implementation

- adapt the nix building process
- enable the Hermes JS engine
- move from deprecated core libs to community libs

## TODO (non-exhaustive)

- [x] Initial source-code migration work on status-react
  - [x] Disable auto-linking during the initial migration
- [x] Migration with AndroidX, Jetifier and Hermes disabled
  - [x] Migrate 3rd-party RN modules (includes move from deprecated core libs to community libs)
- [x] Migration with AndroidX and Jetifier enabled
  - [x] Migrate to AndroidX APIs
  - [x] Fix usage of deprecated ListView reported by RN at startup
- [x] (OPTIONAL) Enable auto-linking for all RN modules supporting it
 
- [x] Migrate Nix release-android build
  - [x] Fix Gradle config overrides not applying correctly to subprojects (not an issue outside of Nix pure builds)
  - [x] Account for `:react-native-android:installArchives` not existing anymore
  - [x] Get rid of Realm, as it is hardcoded to use JSC
- [x] migrate to community version of net-info
- [x] Migration with Hermes enabled
  - [x] Remove RAM bundle (https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/8863)
- [x] get rid of usage of component-will-mount because it is deprecated (https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/8858)
- [x] Fix [issue](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/25601#issuecomment-510856047) running Hermes command in `node_modules/react-native/react.gradle`
- [x] fix migration of react-native-camera (error accessing `.RNCamera`)
- [x] migrate to community version of webviews (might be big)
- [x] Fix CI tests
- [x] Fix Android build on macOS (https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/8952)
- [x] Ensure everything works with iOS
- [ ] Ensure everything works with Desktop
  - [ ] net-info replacement for desktop?



## Acceptance Criteria

- project is now using react-native 0.60.5 (including iOS and Desktop)

Useful resources:
- [RN Upgrade Helper](https://react-native-community.github.io/upgrade-helper/?from=0.59.10&to=0.60.4)
- [Issue when upgrading from below RN 0.60 to RN above 0.60 - AndroidX](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/25924)
- [https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-maps/issues/2954](https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-maps/issues/2954)
- [Migrating from `rnpm` configuration](https://github.com/react-native-community/cli/blob/master/docs/platforms.md#migrating-from-rnpm-configuration)
- [Autolinking](https://github.com/react-native-community/cli/blob/master/docs/autolinking.md)

Some issues observed while migrating:

- `react-native-android` has some build issues (locating hermes) with relative paths. Turned out that it's related to setting `projectDir` in https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/f464269263bec5485c62bb4dc291076cc75177fb/android/settings.gradle#L45-L46. Commenting it out fixes the issue;
- `:react-native-android:installArchives` gradle target doesn't seem to exist anymore;
- Need to [migrate](https://github.com/react-native-community/cli/blob/master/docs/platforms.md#migrating-from-rnpm-configuration) `realm` from `rnpm` configuration (probably already done upstream, so we need to rebase our fork).
- Issues with AndroidX/Jetifier - running `make run-android` fails configuring `react-native-camera`:

Error regarding autolinking:
```
warn Package react-native-firebase has been ignored because it contains invalid configuration. Reason: Unknown option dependency.platforms.android.buildPatch with value "" implementation project(':react-native-firebase')"" was found. This is either a typing error or a user mistake. Fixing it will remove this message.
warn The following packages use deprecated "rnpm" config that will stop working from next release:
  - realm: https://realm.io
Please notify their maintainers about it. You can find more details at https://github.com/react-native-community/cli/blob/master/docs/configuration.md#migration-guide.
error React Native CLI uses autolinking for native dependencies, but the following modules are linked manually: 
  - react-native-background-timer (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-background-timer")
  - react-native-camera (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-camera")
  - react-native-config (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-config")
  - react-native-dialogs (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-dialogs")
  - react-native-fs (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-fs")
  - react-native-gesture-handler (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-gesture-handler")
  - react-native-http-bridge (to unlink run: "react-native unlink react-native-http-bridge")

  - realm (to unlink run: "react-native unlink realm")
This is likely happening when upgrading React Native from below 0.60 to 0.60 or above. Going forward, you can unlink this dependency via "react-native unlink <dependency>" and it will be included in your app automatically. If a library isn't compatible with autolinking, disregard this message and notify the library maintainers.
Read more about autolinking: https://github.com/react-native-community/cli/blob/master/docs/autolinking.md
```
Added a non-exhaustive TODO list in the OP for transparency.
This Realm issue is currently a blocker: https://github.com/realm/realm-js/issues/2455

Current state of this PR (work in debug/release can easily be paralelized):
- Debug app (prioritary to fix):
  - Debug app has an error due to Realm (missing `ListView` component). Once Realm is removed, there are some deprecation warnings that need to be addressed, regarding moving from `componentWillMount` to `componentDidMount`. Reagent also needs updating, but the [fix](https://github.com/reagent-project/reagent/blob/bd8603dce8e675fd4fe4f8c841c4369e4e39421d/src/reagent/impl/component.cljs#L226) is still unreleased.
  - The commit which removes Realm needs some more work after being rebased, as there are new method calls which need to be removed. 
- Release app:
  - Build phase:
    - A new dependency (`@react-native-community/netinfo`) includes a Gradle plugin which is not currently detected by our Nix script. Not prioritary until we release, since we can add dependency manually for now.
